title: Why would Riot remove the tank meta?
body: Like, it was the best meta ever, ADC's could actually be ADC's, assassins could be played, but would have to choose their engages carefully to not get cc locked. Now its just a "tank assassin" meta, with Garen dealing more damage than Zed while being unkillable, or Morde running rampant in kill lanes in the bot that will never be able to deal with him. Or someone like Hecarim who can deal like 800 damage in his E by simply building Trinity Force and Dead Man's Plate. This meta really pisses me off and I'm hoping that Riot can balance it out.

Generally the counter-play to Garen (as a melee) is to wait for his silence to be unavailable, then fight him.  This works for other fighters and bruisers who should be able to fight him head-on.  In a scenario where both champions have even gold and skill level, an assassin will probably never be able to fight Garen properly.

Keep in mind that since the rework, Garen actually became easier to kite.  In normal games or solo queue though, Garen continues to do well for a couple of reasons:

* AD Carries generally cannot peel Garen themselves.  They require a teammate to also CC him, in order to keep your carry alive.
* He does a good bit more damage than we're used to compared to previous Garen, because of new items, his R passive, and his E that spins faster.
* He's fairly simple for your average player (just as before the rework).  Q -> E -> R.  Use W whenever taking heavy damage.

Essentially whenever his R is up, he's one of the most lethal champions in the game.  When it is not though, Garen usually struggles to finish off any targets.  If you want to beat Garen, protect your carries (provided you have the CC to do so).  If you're an assassin, you're probably in for one hellish game (one in which Garen can kill you quite easily, while you barely scratch him).

Tanks are the natural counter to assassins. When tanks were strong, assassins saw less play and were less dominant.
Assassins are known for their flashy plays.
Every year, Riot seems to mysteriously buff flashy champions or nerf their counters in the patches leading up to worlds.

I fully expect Riot to wait until next season, then buff the tanks back up. A tank meta holds down assassins, but it doesn't make them unplayable and it makes the rift safer for more immobile squishy champs, promoting diversity. Then when next season starts to come to an end, the tanks will all get nerfed back down just long enough for worlds. {{champion:64}} will also get a buff for no reason other than to incentivize players to pick him more often.
